name: Event
description: Represents an event, such as a meeting or phone call.
summary:
The `Event` object in Salesforce is designed to track and manage various types of events and activities. It includes a comprehensive set of attributes to cover all aspects of an event, from basic identification to detailed recurrence patterns. Below is a summary of the key attributes:

- **Identification and Relationships:**
  - `Id`: Unique identifier for the event.
  - `WhoId`: Reference to a related contact or lead.
  - `WhatId`: Reference to a related object, such as an account or opportunity.
  - `AccountId`: Reference to the associated account.
  - `OwnerId`: Reference to the user who owns the event.
  - `CreatedById` & `LastModifiedById`: References to users who created and last modified the event, respectively.
  - `ServiceAppointmentId`: Reference to a related service appointment.

- **Event Details:**
  - `Subject`: The subject or title of the event.
  - `Location`: The location where the event takes place.
  - `Description`: Detailed description or notes about the event.
  - `ActivityDateTime`, `StartDateTime`, `EndDateTime`: Date and time when the event starts and ends.
  - `ActivityDate`, `EndDate`: Start and end dates of the event.
  - `DurationInMinutes`: Duration of the event in minutes.

- **Event Features:**
  - `IsAllDayEvent`: Indicates whether the event lasts all day.
  - `IsPrivate`: Marks the event as private.
  - `ShowAs`: Status to show on the calendar (e.g., busy, free).
  - `IsDeleted`, `IsArchived`: Flags for deletion and archiving status.
  - `IsChild`, `IsGroupEvent`, `GroupEventType`: Attributes related to group events and event hierarchy.
  - `EventSubtype`: Specifies the subtype of the event.

- **Recurrence:**
  - `IsRecurrence`, `RecurrenceActivityId`: Attributes related to recurring events.
  - `RecurrenceStartDateTime`, `RecurrenceEndDateOnly`: Start and end dates for the recurrence pattern.
  - `RecurrenceTimeZoneSidKey`: Time zone for the recurrence.
  - `RecurrenceType`, `RecurrenceInterval`, `RecurrenceDayOfWeekMask`, `RecurrenceDayOfMonth`, `RecurrenceInstance`, `RecurrenceMonthOfYear`: Various attributes defining the recurrence pattern.
  - `IsRecurrence2`, `IsRecurrence2Exception`, `IsRecurrence2Exclusion`, `Recurrence2PatternText`, `Recurrence2PatternVersion`, `Recurrence2PatternStartDate`, `Recurrence2PatternTimeZone`: Additional attributes for more complex recurrence patterns.

- **Reminders:**
  - `ReminderDateTime`: Date and time for the event reminder.
  - `IsReminderSet`: Indicates if a reminder is set.

- **System Information:**
  - `CreatedDate`, `LastModifiedDate`, `SystemModstamp`: Timestamps for creation, last modification, and system updates.

This comprehensive set of attributes makes the `Event` object versatile, enabling detailed tracking and management of various types of events within Salesforce.
label: Event
